serofoi 0.1.0

    Fit Model

    fit_model.Rd

    Function that fits the selected model to the data

    Usage

    fit_model(
  model_data,
  model_name,
  n_iters = 1000,
  n_thin = 2,
  delta = 0.9,
  m_treed = 10,
  decades = 0
)

    Arguments

    model_data

    A data frame containing the data from a seroprevalence survey. For further details refer to run_model.

    model_name

    Name of the selected model. Current version provides three options:

    constant_foi_bi

    Runs a constant model

    continuous_foi_normal_bi

    Runs a normal model

    continuous_foi_normal_log

    Runs a normal logarithmic model

    n_iters

    Number of interations for eah chain including the warmup. iter in sampling.

    n_thin

    Positive integer specifying the period for saving samples. thin in sampling.

    delta

    Real number between 0 and 1 that represents the target average acceptance probability. Increasing the value of delta will result in a smaller step size and fewer divergences. For further details refer to the control parameter in sampling or here.

    m_treed

    Maximum tree depth for the binary tree used in the NUTS stan sampler. For further details refer to the control parameter in sampling.

    decades

    Number of decades covered by the survey data.

    Value

    model_object. An object containing relevant information about the implementation of the model. It contains the following:

    fitstanfit object returned by the function sampling
    model_dataA data frame containing the data from a seroprevalence survey. For further details refer to run_model.
    stan_dataList containing Nobs, Npos, Ntotal, Age, Ymax, AgeExpoMatrix and NDecades. This object is used as an input for the sampling function
    real_exposure_yearsInteger atomic vector containing the actual exposure years (1946, ..., 2007 e.g.)
    exposure_yearsInteger atomic vector containing the numeration of the exposure years.
    n_itersNumber of interations for eah chain including the warmup.
    n_thinPositive integer specifying the period for saving samples.
    n_warmupNumber of warm up iterations. Set by default as n_iters/2.
    model_nameThe name of the model
    deltaReal number between 0 and 1 that represents the target average acceptance probability.
    m_treedMaximum tree depth for the binary tree used in the NUTS stan sampler.
    loo_fitEfficient approximate leave-one-out cross-validation. Refer to loo for further details.
    foi_cent_estA data fram e containing year (corresponding to real_exposure_years), lower, upper, and medianv
    foi_post_sSample n rows from a table. Refer to sample_n for further details.
    model_summaryA data fram containing the summary of the model. Refer to extract_model_summary for further details.

    Examples

    model_data <- prepare_data(mydata)
fit_model (model_data,
           model_name = "constant_foi_bi")
#> Warning: Model constant_foi_bi is being compiled for the first time. This might take some minutes
#> Warning: path[1]="inst/extdata/stanmodels/constant_foi_bi.stan": No such file or directory
#> Warning: cannot open file 'inst/extdata/stanmodels/constant_foi_bi.stan': No such file or directory
#> Error in file(fname, "rt") : cannot open the connection
#> Error in get_model_strcode(file, model_code): cannot open model file "inst/extdata/stanmodels/constant_foi_bi.stan"
